# 1. Loading R Packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggstatsplot)
```
:::


# 2. Importing the data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


#3 Visualisation 

## 3.1 One-sample test: gghistostats() method (Parametric)

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "parametric",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color = "black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve = FALSE,
  normal.curve.args = list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
) 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.2 One-sample test: gghistostats() method (Non-Parametric)

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

p <- gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "np",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color = "black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve = FALSE,
  normal.curve.args = list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
) 
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
extract_stats(p)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


## 3.3 One-sample test: gghistostats() method (Robust - Removed outlier)

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "robust",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color = "black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve = FALSE,
  normal.curve.args = list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
) 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.4 One-sample test: gghistostats() method (Bayesian)

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "bayes",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color = "black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve = TRUE,
  normal.curve.args = list(linewidth=0.5),
  xlab = "English scores"
) 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.5 Engilish score vs Class ggdotplotstats()

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggdotplotstats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH, 
  y = CLASS,
  type = "",
  xlab = ""
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.6 Scores vs Subject ggwithinstats()

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_long <- exam %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = ENGLISH:SCIENCE,
    names_to = "SUBJECT",
    values_to = "SCORES") %>%
  filter(CLASS == "3A")

ggwithinstats(
  data = filter(exam_long,
                SUBJECT %in%
                  c("MATHS","SCIENCE")),
  x = SUBJECT, 
  y = SCORES,
  type = "p",
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
